DOC.HEAD: Small Earthquake Near San Bernardino
DOC.TEXT: A small earthquake struck Wednesday seven miles northwest of here and there were no reports of damage or injury. The 2:10 p.m. quake measured 3.2 on the Richter scale of ground motion, said California Institute of Technology spokesman Hall Daily in Pasadena. A dispatcher at the San Bernardino Police Department said she had received several calls from residents asking about the quake, but there were no reports of trouble. An earthquake of 3.5 on the Richter scale can cause slight damage in the local area. San Bernardino is about 55 miles east of Los Angeles.
